metadata.title: CVE-2021-47330 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: tty:serial: 8250: serial_cs: Fix a memory leak in error handling path In theprobe function, if the final 'serial_config()' fails, 'info' is leaking.Add a resource handling path to free this memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1').
